document.heading: Office of Independent Juvenile Justice Facilities Oversight Plan Emergency Amendment Act of 2025

To eliminate, on an emergency basis, the requirement that the Office of Independent Juvenile Justice Facilities Oversight must present a plan to the Council regarding the continuation of the functions of the office.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Office of Independent Juvenile Justice Facilities Oversight Plan Emergency Amendment Act of 2025".

section.text: Section 5012(b)(4) of the Juvenile Justice Facilities Oversight Act of 2024, effective September 18, 2024 (D.C. Law 25-217; D.C. Official Code § 2-1533.01, note), is repealed.
section.codify:annotation: For a temporary (90 days) repeal of the continuation of operations of the Office of Independent Juvenile Facilities Oversight, established pursuant to section VIII of Mayor's Order 2020-115 and extended by Mayor's Order 2023-146, throughout Fiscal Year 2025 as a program within the Office of the District of Columbia Auditor, see section 2 of D.C. Act 26-18.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
